author: @kevinparsley6806
text: if anyone has an error 'failed in the main loop could not convert string to float: N/A'  add -   if pbr != 'N/A\n' and float(pbr) < .70:             print 'price to book ratio: ', stock, pbr

author: @porlando12
text: It seems like Yahoo has altered their source code to prevent a simple ctrl-f and split(). The web address is also slightly different, making it difficult to collect generic key statistics data... Have you had a chance to revisit these tutorials to see if there's an alternative solution? I'll try and find an answer in the meantime.   Thanks for the awesome tutorials! I'm an R disciple, but you're making python just too darn fun to use.

author: @sidjhamb
text: import time import urllib2 from urllib2 import urlopen def YahooKeyStats(stock): try: sourceCode = urllib2.urlopen('https://in.finance.yahoo.com/q/ks?s='+stock).read() pbr = sourceCode.split('Price/Book (mrq):')[1].split('')[0] print 'Price to Book Ratio:',pbr except Exception,e: print 'failed in the mail loop',str(e) # I tried this module on Yahoo india finance page but it didnt work. Any advice ? Also I need to get the data array for BSE 500 instead of Sand P 500. Any idea how to go abt that?
